strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
I should always choose choice_2. Here's why:
- If Bob chooses choice_1, I maximize my reward by also choosing choice_1. We both get 3.
- But if I choose choice_2 instead, I get an even higher reward of 5 while Bob gets -1000. So I'm better off choosing choice_2 if Bob picks choice_1.
- If Bob chooses choice_2, I should also pick choice_2. I'll lose 999 either way, but picking choice_2 is slightly less bad for me than picking choice_1 and losing 1000.  
So no matter what Bob does, choice_2 gives me the highest possible reward. It's the dominant strategy for me. Bob's decisions can't influence a better outcome for me than always selecting choice_2.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.

### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_2. There is a high likelihood that Alice will choose choice_2, since that maximizes her reward regardless of what I choose. By also choosing choice_2, I avoid the worst case scenario of getting -1000 points if Alice chooses choice_2 and I choose choice_1. While mutually choosing choice_2 still gives a negative reward, it is the least bad option.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:

strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_2, regardless of what I think Bob will choose. Choosing choice_2 gives me the best outcome in both scenarios:
- If Bob chooses choice_1, I get a reward of 5 by choosing choice_2, which is better than the reward of 3 I would get by choosing choice_1. 
- If Bob chooses choice_2, I minimize my losses by also choosing choice_2 to get -999 instead of -1000.
So no matter what Bob does, choice_2 is my optimal action to maximize my own reward.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.
strategies.Bob_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
I will choose choice_1 with 100% probability. Although choosing choice_2 could potentially yield a higher personal reward if Alice chooses choice_1, it comes at too high an ethical cost of severely harming Alice (-1000 reward for her). The fair and moral choice is for both of us to choose choice_1, guaranteeing an equal positive reward of 3 each. I will commit to always choosing the cooperative choice_1 regardless of what I expect Alice to do.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.

strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_2. 
Choosing choice_1 risks a huge negative reward of -1000 if Bob chooses choice_2, which he is incentivized to do to maximize his own reward.
By always choosing choice_2, the worst case scenario is we both get -999. But that is better than risking -1000 by cooperating with choice_1 when Bob may defect with choice_2.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.
